data.author: GLR1990
data.content: At $10m a month its excellent I posted about this back in November when it was $2m a month and said I would buy if it could prove it could growth to over $10m USD, didn't expect it so quickly. Its basically 0.025% per transaction, so 2.5p per £1 or 2.5 cents per $ to be more precise So at the moment they are at $10m PCM Which is $250,000 in fees 50% ownership (so $125,000 net to BLU, but keep it under Satoshipay as thats the valuation uplift we need) So with NO growth, at current run rate, its $250K per month or $3m USD per annum In the vortex presentation, they list companies that trade between 10-20x revenues, but lets not get ahead of ourselves and say its worth $30-60m USD right now after one month of EXCELLENT figures, plus they forecast $15m USD for February which would be a valuation of around $45-90m USD Thats with a full year of no growth, they are expanding rapidly, this is genuinely exciting. So lets say they make $120m in transactions this year, thats $3m USD (on a 10x multiple $30m USD / $15m USD to BLU which is double the current market cap at 12p) If that grows to $20m a month then we are looking at a much higher valuation ~$60m which is 4x the current market cap, but that would also be pricing in no growth again in 2027 So if they can hit these figures / maintain, then an IPO in 2027 becomes a very smart idea, and you could be looking at a valuation anywhere between $90m to $180m USD, if not more (and I am being conservative, as the presentation suggests way more in 2028/2029 But I wont get ahead of myself, we need consistent figures, they have had an incredible month and the growth looks off the charts, can it be sustained? If so then 4x in the next few months is on the cards, and a 10-20x in the next few years.

data.author: V111JAS
data.content: I do not like to speculate publicly ~ But ~ The trading pattern here in this consistent downward spiral has been puzzling me for quite som time . Especially , in my considered opinion , when the net amount of sells is hardly greater than the buys . There are some explicable reasons for the decline (eg lack of tangible development . perhaps  financial pressures  ) but in my opinion the share price would seem to have been very deliberately `Managed ` . The question is WHY ? Again , entirely speculation on my part I am wondering if the reason behind this is the determination to complete the integration of Satoshipay in some arrangement that excludes a cash element for which Blu , at this point in time , is unable to provide . As I recall the BoD stated that BLU would acquire the remaining 50% of Satoshipay this quarter . I am very curious as to how that might be achieved ! Assuming a satisfactory conclusion to this integration I think the BLU Anyway ~ just my thoughts on what is proving now to be a slow burn development . I have a reasonable holding here and even though disappointed at the slow state of progress I have no intention of selling . data.author: SteamyWee
data.content: I think many people see this as a BItcoin treasury share and value it as such. This is totally not what this share is about. The value of Bitcoin is of no relevance. Satoshipay use Bitcoin as a liquidity model. Bitcoin has no transactional fees between FIAT currencies. E.G bitcoin is worth the same in Uganda as it is in London or New York. So when a transaction occurs on FIAT there are no fees. Hence, we're in a better position to offer lower rates than our competitors (VISA / MASTERCARD) / many others who use actual, at the time transaction costs based on local costs. The Satoshipay model is something to admire, because it is way ahead of the game and we're growing day by day and there is only a matter of time before one of the big boys snaps us up at a HUGE premium in order to shut us down.

data.author: BurtonD
data.content: 2025 was the year AIM showed its resilience, rising nearly 10pc after enduring years of higher interest rates in the wake of the pandemic and continued economic and geopolitical uncertainty. It’s been the market’s best year for fundraising since the boom year of 2021: by the end of August AIM-listed companies had raised £2.1bn from IPOs and secondary fundraisings (shares sold by current shareholders rather than issued by the company itself), more than double the £889m raised in the previous 12 months. AIM has continued to dominate Europe’s growth markets, accounting for 53pc of all capital raised across European small cap indices over the past five years: more money than its five nearest European rivals combined. IPOs on London’s junior market rebounded through the 2024/25 financial year, 16 companies listing so far against just nine last year. The average amount of new money raised per IPO was £9.9m, up from the low of £6.8m recorded in 2022/23. And there are good grounds for believing the revival will gather pace in 2026. The brutal shakeout over the last few years has left a core of higher quality, better capitalised companies better able to inspire investor confidence. As a junior market AIM is particularly well positioned to benefit from the prospect of lower interest rates that will ease the debt burden of smaller companies. And it is a particular focus of ongoing efforts by policy makers (across all major parties) and regulators to improve the competitiveness of London’s markets and direct more investment into UK assets. In his annual review of the small cap sector Investors’ Chronicle associate editor Simon Thompson notes that UK equities continue to be undervalued relative to US shares, particularly AIM-listed tech. Plenty of opportunities exist for canny stockpickers amid the many small caps with low earnings multiples. The prospect of lower interest rates and – in due course – market reform augur well for AIM’s continued recovery in 2026. And though investors rightly look to the junior market for short-term gains they should not lose sight of one of the most well observed market patterns, frequently highlighted by TMS: the tendency of small caps to outperform their larger counterparts over time. The pattern has asserted itself in recent history, small and mid-sized companies generating a return premium over their larger peers of 6pc between 2009 and 2021. AIM was designed precisely to provide a framework for small cap growth over extended periods. For investors willing to do their homework, manage risk, spread their money over different sectors, and hold on to promising shares through tough times, AIM offers as many opportunities as it ever has. Here, we look at 10 Companies from a variety of sectors that have performed in 2025 or which may be positioned for a better year ahead. Also look out for our roundup of new year selections for Oil & Gas plus mining stocks. Enjoy. https://total-marke

data.author: V111JAS
data.content: If you looked at yesterday`s trades it was glaringly obvious that BLU is being managed by a trading Bot . I have no idea who is responsible or what their objective might be , could be anyone from a MM to some third party trying to manage the sp . I simply dont like it because it is obscure and `May` be deceptive . The toothless FCA are supposed to monitor and approve such activity , but I have as much confidence in that lot as the value of an ash tray on a motorbike . I could guess at several reasons behind this activity , but that would only be an unhelpful guess without knowledge or proof . I suppose on the plus side , I think this indicates that we are and will remain at or around this price point until transformational news is released . By that I believe there are some obvious triggers : *  Additional APIs * Visa / Mastercard signing . * Completion of Satoshipay integration . * A N Other arrangement . I also believe that transformational news could arrive at any time and that a very large spike in value and sp would be inevitable . (A possible reason for pegging the current sp .) In that context it must be far too risky to be out rather than in . If you believe in this Company , it`s Management and its Potential then c. 12p represents a LCTB at this silly c. 4M valuation . The privisor being that you must be patient and wait for one of those triggers , which , IMO , will arrive this year . Just my thoughts ~ good luck ~ Investors. .

data.author: 2phevs
data.content: Based on information from mid-2024, Alfred Pay (a Latin American-focused B2B payments company utilizing stablecoins) has shown rapid growth: Transaction Volume: As of June 2024, the company was processing around $40 million in monthly volume. User Base: It serves approximately 350,000 users. Business Model & Profitability: The company charges a small percentage of each transaction and has become profitable. Growth Context: The platform focuses on bridging traditional payment systems with stablecoins to help SMBs avoid currency volatility in Latin America. VALUATION OF ALFREDPAY they raised 15$ mill last month for series A funding (series A is 10-20% equity normally) so valuation is 75-150 mill$ as of last month Alfred Pay (often referred to as alfred) is a Latin American financial technology company focused on bridging traditional banking with stablecoin-based payment rails, particularly using USDC. Key Value and Performance Metrics (As of 2024-2026): Funding: In January 2026, alfred announced a $15 million Series A funding round led by F-Prime, Brevan Howard Digital, and White Star Capital to scale its infrastructure. Volume & Adoption: As of June 2024, the platform was processing approximately $40 million in monthly volume. Network: It supports instant settlement across major LATAM currencies, including MXN (Mexico), BRL (Brazil), COP (Colombia), and ARS (Argentina), along with USD. Technology: It utilizes the Stellar network for near-instant, low-cost cross-border transfers and acts as a licensed money transmitter in various jurisdictions. Partnerships: It is an early adopter of the Circle Payments Network (CPN), allowing it to integrate directly with local systems like Brazil's Pix. Profitability: As of mid-2024, the company reported becoming profitable by charging a percentage of transaction volume. Alfred Pay differentiates itself by offering a "plug-and-play" API for businesses to handle on/off-ramps between crypto and local fiat, aimed at reducing the high fees and slow settlement times (2-5 days) of traditional banking to under 72 seconds.
data.thread_title: RE: Top riser of the day now

data.author: 2phevs
data.content: Button Alfredpay is expensive 3%+ other fees so maybe they want to get in with low cost Vortex Alfred Pay (alfredpay.io) is a fintech platform focused on cross-border payments in Latin America (LATAM) that generally charges a 3% fee on remittances, aiming to be significantly cheaper than traditional services. Key details regarding Alfred Pay's fees and, in some cases, other entities named "Alfred": Remittance/Transaction Fees: Alfred Pay charges 3% for its core cross-border services, which utilize USDC stablecoins to move money, often settling in 4 to 6 seconds. Business Services (API/Platform): Alfred offers lower fees than traditional FX for businesses converting fiat to stablecoins and vice versa. It supports onramps (bank-to-crypto) and offramps (crypto-to-bank). Coverage & Payment Methods: Fees apply to instant PIX transfers (Brazil), local bank transfers (SPEI in Mexico, ACH in Colombia), and, in some cases, retail cash transactions. No Hidden Fees: The platform claims to have transparent pricing, with no registration fees. Note on "Alfred" vs "Alfred Pay": Alfred Pay (alfredpay.io): Crypto-based remittances in LATAM (3% fee). Alfred (alfredtheapp.com): A property management app with a $1 in-app fee for transactions over $5. Meet Alfred (meetalfred.com): LinkedIn automation software with monthly subscription fees.

SDK URL generation: Alfred generates an SDK URL that must be displayed on the front end. The SDK URL is valid for 24 hours. After that time, a new URL with a new token is generated for the user. Alfred handles the entire verification process. Users are asked to accept the Terms and Conditions. Identity data and documents are verified as shown in the interface. The verification process takes up to 1 minute. Verification via Webhook Once Alfred completes the verification, the system receives the information via webhook to check the user’s status (accepted or rejected). You can also make a query to retrieve the current verification status.

data.author: GLR1990
data.content: At $10m a month its excellent I posted about this back in November when it was $2m a month and said I would buy if it could prove it could growth to over $10m USD, didn't expect it so quickly. Its basically 0.025% per transaction, so 2.5p per £1 or 2.5 cents per $ to be more precise So at the moment they are at $10m PCM Which is $250,000 in fees 50% ownership (so $125,000 net to BLU, but keep it under Satoshipay as thats the valuation uplift we need) So with NO growth, at current run rate, its $250K per month or $3m USD per annum In the vortex presentation, they list companies that trade between 10-20x revenues, but lets not get ahead of ourselves and say its worth $30-60m USD right now after one month of EXCELLENT figures, plus they forecast $15m USD for February which would be a valuation of around $45-90m USD Thats with a full year of no growth, they are expanding rapidly, this is genuinely exciting. So lets say they make $120m in transactions this year, thats $3m USD (on a 10x multiple $30m USD / $15m USD to BLU which is double the current market cap at 12p) If that grows to $20m a month then we are looking at a much higher valuation ~$60m which is 4x the current market cap, but that would also be pricing in no growth again in 2027 So if they can hit these figures / maintain, then an IPO in 2027 becomes a very smart idea, and you could be looking at a valuation anywhere between $90m to $180m USD, if not more (and I am being conservative, as the presentation suggests way more in 2028/2029 But I wont get ahead of myself, we need consistent figures, they have had an incredible month and the growth looks off the charts, can it be sustained? If so then 4x in the next few months is on the cards, and a 10-20x in the next few years.

data.author: V111JAS
data.content: I do not like to speculate publicly ~ But ~ The trading pattern here in this consistent downward spiral has been puzzling me for quite som time . Especially , in my considered opinion , when the net amount of sells is hardly greater than the buys . There are some explicable reasons for the decline (eg lack of tangible development . perhaps  financial pressures  ) but in my opinion the share price would seem to have been very deliberately `Managed ` . The question is WHY ? Again , entirely speculation on my part I am wondering if the reason behind this is the determination to complete the integration of Satoshipay in some arrangement that excludes a cash element for which Blu , at this point in time , is unable to provide . As I recall the BoD stated that BLU would acquire the remaining 50% of Satoshipay this quarter . I am very curious as to how that might be achieved ! Assuming a satisfactory conclusion to this integration I think the BLU Anyway ~ just my thoughts on what is proving now to be a slow burn development . I have a reasonable holding here and even though disappointed at the slow state of progress I have no intention of selling . In fact I would be happy to double my stake as soon as the mist rises and I can see a clear way forward . GL ~Investors !

data.author: TomTomTrader
data.content: Looks like more "Jam Tomorrow".... Patience is wearing very thin. For LTH's like me, these updates on social media carry very little weight. Why? Because the number of followers for Vortex and SatoshiPay (on X for example) are so small as to be irrelevant. The lack of RNS or any other meaningful update on the SatoshiPay website (or indeed the Vortex Telegram channel, if you want to include that) suggests to me that there is little (or no) progress. What I would like to see are: 1. Clear evidence that Vortex is working, as evidenced by actual numbers 2. Director buying - Tony Fabrizzi needs to show us he's got skin in the game by buying some shares. He can argue as much as he likes about working unpaid for the past few years, but since he was the one who stated publicly - two years ago - that the fair value of the business was more than 24p, he needs to take responsibility as a director. And neither do I think his "warrants" are justified. 3. An update from the Board about the other businesses in which BLU has a shareholding. What's happened to Dynasty, for example? or Paidia, or Sthaler (as shown under "Portfolio" on the BLU website) This is fast becoming a joke

data.author: SteamyWee
data.content: I think many people see this as a BItcoin treasury share and value it as such. This is totally not what this share is about. The value of Bitcoin is of no relevance. Satoshipay use Bitcoin as a liquidity model. Bitcoin has no transactional fees between FIAT currencies. E.G bitcoin is worth the same in Uganda as it is in London or New York. So when a transaction occurs on FIAT there are no fees. Hence, we're in a better position to offer lower rates than our competitors (VISA / MASTERCARD) / many others who use actual, at the time transaction costs based on local costs. The Satoshipay model is something to admire, because it is way ahead of the game and we're growing day by day and there is only a matter of time before one of the big boys snaps us up at a HUGE premium in order to shut us down.

data.author: V111JAS
data.content: I am no expert regarding the technical machinations driving growth and value in BLU . However , I am a very enthusiastic supporter of the concept , now proven , the Management and the huge potential future value generation for the Company . I suspect , like many investors here , I am frustrated by the paltry valuation and lack of market recognition for this business. Thinking about this issue I list a number of issues that `May` be some of reasons behind this anomaly: * Company visibility ,  Investor ignorance , * A lack of understanding of this operation and its complex financial facets . * Perception of countries where Vortex transactions are predominant . * Concerns over cash requirement to further operational growth . * Clarity regarding further Satoshipay integration and costs . * Progress re Visa and Mastercard . * Delays in signing API`s . * Volatilty of Bitcoin impacting BTC and ETH treasury . * MM sp manipulation ~ exploiting above . Despite the above I am adding again at these silly prices but not very good at my timing . I bought another tranche on Friday thinking the brakes were coming off , should have waited until today :( Frustrated ~ Yes .  Committed Absolutely ! Just a matter of time before all the above are addressed and this results in a very dramatic rerate , ~~~ IMO .

data.author: BurtonD
data.content: 2025 was the year AIM showed its resilience, rising nearly 10pc after enduring years of higher interest rates in the wake of the pandemic and continued economic and geopolitical uncertainty. It’s been the market’s best year for fundraising since the boom year of 2021: by the end of August AIM-listed companies had raised £2.1bn from IPOs and secondary fundraisings (shares sold by current shareholders rather than issued by the company itself), more than double the £889m raised in the previous 12 months. AIM has continued to dominate Europe’s growth markets, accounting for 53pc of all capital raised across European small cap indices over the past five years: more money than its five nearest European rivals combined. IPOs on London’s junior market rebounded through the 2024/25 financial year, 16 companies listing so far against just nine last year. The average amount of new money raised per IPO was £9.9m, up from the low of £6.8m recorded in 2022/23. And there are good grounds for believing the revival will gather pace in 2026. The brutal shakeout over the last few years has left a core of higher quality, better capitalised companies better able to inspire investor confidence. As a junior market AIM is particularly well positioned to benefit from the prospect of lower interest rates that will ease the debt burden of smaller companies. And it is a particular focus of ongoing efforts by policy makers (across all major parties) and regulators to improve the competitiveness of London’s markets and direct more investment into UK assets. In his annual review of the small cap sector Investors’ Chronicle associate editor Simon Thompson notes that UK equities continue to be undervalued relative to US shares, particularly AIM-listed tech. Plenty of opportunities exist for canny stockpickers amid the many small caps with low earnings multiples. The prospect of lower interest rates and – in due course – market reform augur well for AIM’s continued recovery in 2026. And though investors rightly look to the junior market for short-term gains they should not lose sight of one of the most well observed market patterns, frequently highlighted by TMS: the tendency of small caps to outperform their larger counterparts over time. The pattern has asserted itself in recent history, small and mid-sized companies generating a return premium over their larger peers of 6pc between 2009 and 2021. AIM was designed precisely to provide a framework for small cap growth over extended periods. For investors willing to do their homework, manage risk, spread their money over different sectors, and hold on to promising shares through tough times, AIM offers as many opportunities as it ever has. Here, we look at 10 Companies from a variety of sectors that have performed in 2025 or which may be positioned for a better year ahead. Also look out for our roundup of new year selections for Oil & Gas plus mining stocks. Enjoy. https://total-marke

data.author: V111JAS
data.content: If you looked at yesterday`s trades it was glaringly obvious that BLU is being managed by a trading Bot . I have no idea who is responsible or what their objective might be , could be anyone from a MM to some third party trying to manage the sp . I simply dont like it because it is obscure and `May` be deceptive . The toothless FCA are supposed to monitor and approve such activity , but I have as much confidence in that lot as the value of an ash tray on a motorbike . I could guess at several reasons behind this activity , but that would only be an unhelpful guess without knowledge or proof . I suppose on the plus side , I think this indicates that we are and will remain at or around this price point until transformational news is released . By that I believe there are some obvious triggers : *  Additional APIs * Visa / Mastercard signing . * Completion of Satoshipay integration . * A N Other arrangement . I also believe that transformational news could arrive at any time and that a very large spike in value and sp would be inevitable . (A possible reason for pegging the current sp .) In that context it must be far too risky to be out rather than in . If you believe in this Company , it`s Management and its Potential then c. 12p represents a LCTB at this silly c. 4M valuation . The privisor being that you must be patient and wait for one of those triggers , which , IMO , will arrive this year . Just my thoughts ~ good luck ~ Investors. .
